channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024021012
item.description:
Report X-2024021012

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: a trainer informed one the admin that there was a leaking hazmat on a trailer. Grabbed my PPE and the red hazardous waste bin to get the damaged hazmat. Brought it back to QA, began to inspect. There were 4 bottles in a black trash bag. DescribePack: One of the bottle liquid level was lower than the rest. The cap does not look like it was completely secured on the bottle and leaked out. DurationRel: 18 and MitigateEffect: Kept the box and the bottles upright to prevent any more leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024021095
item.description:
Report X-2024021095

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver brought the leaker to QA cage 1, stating that it was leaking and it could not be delivered. The package was immediately put into a lined spill bin while the SDS was pulled up. The SDS revealed it was a limited quantity and needed to be processed as a damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Box was soggy and the bottles had broken through the wet cardboard. One bottle had completely leaked and was tipped over. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box put into tote to prevent more leakage, lids were tightened

item.title: Report X-2024020603
item.description:
Report X-2024020603

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package presented in Unload, and had small amount of leakage on the outside of package. Given to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Inspection found a dent in the metal container lid where and estimated 2oz of liquid was released. The outter package had no indications of being damaged with the exception of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was contained to package. Package was taken to Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020333
item.description:
Report X-2024020333

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: MUNCY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by a package handler during the morning unload. Manager was informed and package was brought to QA to be processed. DescribePack: The package contained 4 bottles of rapicide cleaner. 1 was wet but lid appeared tight. Assuming product froze since it was below zero. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Made sure that all lids were tight and placed back in securely.

item.title: Report X-2024020773
item.description:
Report X-2024020773

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: HERMITAGE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At the time of unloading this bucket from the trailer, the staff realized that it had spilled a little and so they called QA, we looked for the ERG and we printed the SDS and then proceeded to clean up the spill. DescribePack: The lid of the bucket was not fully secured, which caused it to open and spill its contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill area was cleaned, the bucket with the muriatic acid was placed inside a black bin to prevent further/more spillage, and the bucket was taken to the Hazmat cage andplace in a drum.

item.title: Report X-2024020335
item.description:
Report X-2024020335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: NORTH WALES
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought to QA attention on 01/16 this happened in the night shift, and it was moved to the hazmat processing area by QA. DescribePack: Package was leaking in the unloading area, recip noticed damaged box. Inner contents 1 2.5GAL plastic bottle, the cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package taken off unloading area and moved to hazmat processing area by QA.
